intro: Arenaria minutissima, commonly known as the dwarf sandwort, is a small flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and tiny, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in rocky habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
